aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological Information and Flight Plan for N5596X Accident
The accident site had Visual Meteorological Conditions (VMC).
The observation facility was KPNC at an elevation of 1008 feet mean sea level.
The observation time was 11:53 Local.
The lowest cloud condition was Clear.
There was no ceiling at the accident site.
The wind speed was 4 knots.
The wind direction was 130 degrees.
The altimeter setting was 29.96 inches of mercury.
There was no obscuration at the accident site.
There was no precipitation at the accident site.
The departure point was Newkirk, Oklahoma.
The destination was Newkirk, Oklahoma (OK48).
The departure time was 11:50 Local.
The aircraft registration was N5596X.
N5596X was an airplane.
The serial number of N5596X was 5095R.
N5596X had 1 seat.
The certified maximum gross weight of N5596X was 6000 pounds.
The engine manufacturer was WALTER.
The engine model/series was M601E-11.
The rated power of the engine was 751 Horsepower.
The condition of light was Day.
The accident site was 14 Nautical Miles from KPNC.
The accident site was 204 degrees from KPNC.
The visibility was 10 miles.
The temperature was 36 degrees Celsius.
The dew point was 15 degrees Celsius.
No flight plan was filed.
No clearance was issued.

text:
# Meteorological Information and Flight Plan

## Conditions at Accident Site:
Visual (VMC)

## Observation Facility, Elevation:
KPNC,1008 ft msl

## Observation Time:
11:53 Local

## Lowest Cloud Condition:
Clear

## Lowest Ceiling:
None

## Wind Speed/Gusts:
4 knots /

## Wind Direction:
130

## Altimeter Setting:
29.96 inches Hg

## Precipitation and Obscuration:
No Obscuration; No Precipitation

## Departure Point:
Newkirk, OK

## Destination:
Newkirk, OK (OK48)

## Departure Time:
11:50 Local

Registration: N5596X

Aircraft Category: Airplane

Serial Number: 5095R

Seats: 1

Certified Max Gross Wt.: 6000 lbs

Engine Manufacturer: WALTER

Engine Model/Series: M601E-11

Rated Power: 751 Horsepower

Operating Certificate(s) Held:

Condition of Light: Day

Distance from Accident Site: 14 Nautical Miles

Direction from Accident Site: 204

Visibility 10 miles

Visibility (RVR):

Turbulence Type Forecast/Actual:
 / 

Turbulence Severity Forecast/Actual:
 / 

Temperature/Dew Point: 36C / 15C

Type of Flight Plan Filed: None

Type of Clearance: None

Type of Airspace:

---
